comments.body: @saoudrizwan not sure how to avoid using module imports for types in the global version. They are explicitly typed and exported as names so that functions for `.on()`/`.off()` can type their signatures, since `.on()`/`.off()` are reference-based as usual.

diffHunk:

braintree.dropin.create({ authorization: "", container: "my-div" }, (error, myDropin) => {
